body:
I'm getting the following errors when I run the tests:

``` bash
ERROR in ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js
Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'react/addons' in /Users/mozilla/github/mozzy/normandy/node_modules/enzyme/build
 @ ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js 40:16-39 41:46-69

ERROR in ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js
Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'react/lib/ReactContext' in /Users/mozilla/github/mozzy/normandy/node_modules/enzyme/build
 @ ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js 42:23-56

ERROR in ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js
Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'react/lib/ExecutionEnvironment' in /Users/mozilla/github/mozzy/normandy/node_modules/enzyme/build
 @ ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js 72:4-45
```

Although they don't seem to prevent the tests from actually running. Did you get these same errors er nah? A little googling sent me to this [issue](https://github.com/airbnb/enzyme/issues/47) and it looks like the solution would be to add the following to the webpack object in our `karma.conf.js`:

``` javascript
      externals: {
        'react/addons': true,
        'react/lib/ReactContext': true,
        'react/lib/ExecutionEnvironment': true,
      },
```

Although they don't seem to prevent the tests from actually running. Did you get these same errors er nah? A little googling sent me to this issue and it looks like the solution would be to add the following to the webpack object in our karma.conf.js:

ERROR in ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js
Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'react/addons' in /Users/mozilla/github/mozzy/normandy/node_modules/enzyme/build
 @ ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js 40:16-39 41:46-69

ERROR in ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js
Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'react/lib/ReactContext' in /Users/mozilla/github/mozzy/normandy/node_modules/enzyme/build
 @ ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js 42:23-56

ERROR in ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js
Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'react/lib/ExecutionEnvironment' in /Users/mozilla/github/mozzy/normandy/node_modules/enzyme/build
 @ ./~/enzyme/build/react-compat.js 72:4-45

Although they don't seem to prevent the tests from actually running. Did you get these same errors er nah? A little googling sent me to this issue and it looks like the solution would be to add the following to the webpack object in our karma.conf.js:

      externals: {
        'react/addons': true,
        'react/lib/ReactContext': true,
        'react/lib/ExecutionEnvironment': true,
      },
